ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: This is a seminar class, which requires no work outside the classroom.
None
None

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This course is pretty unnecessary in terms of how long it is. I feel like it might be more efficient in the future to touch on all topics covered in a 3-hour or so session (we probably don't even need three hours). The primary points of interest, in my mind, are:1. Authorship issues and considerations2. Plagiarism
A complete waste of time. If it wasn't required to go and sign in, I would not have bothered going at all.
We have discussed a lot of interesting topics and gained necessary ethics training. This course is excellent. There is no weaknesses.
It helps us know more about research ethics and also policy of the university.

It was a nice intro the way things are actually done. Some of the non-Chris presenters gave introductions that were dry and too clean-cut--I think several of us found the ethics particularly to use examples that were too clean and not address issues we'd more likely see.

A more than manageable adequate overview of what is required for good research practices. Clearly only grazes the surface but between guest lecturers and links/references provided in the presentations, the opportunities to engage further are there.

It is a very good seminar. More practical examples are needed. Required to complete an online course, such as those offered by the CITI program, could be a good way to reinforce what is teaching in the course and at the same time the students can obtain a certificate that could be needed later.
good

Much more useful and interesting that I expected from a required ethics class. I would say the sexual harassment session was not as useful or relevant as it could have been; I would like to see more complex and real-life examples provided that go beyond the typical examples of sexual harassment. I also thought the IRB talk was extremely dry; perhaps a different speaker could be used next time?
Interesting and important topics covered.
Useful course.
Very good
Good overall

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Very nice and thoughtful

Instructor: Christian Tschudi  An interesting professor, but the information was just repetitive of what has already been drilled into our heads from day 1. The material was dull and pointless and no instructor could have made it worthwhile.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Christian is very responsible and helpful.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  He teaches very well.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  I like that Chris was honest about how he really sees things instead of following a sterile syllabus of how it all should work.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  A direct, genuine, knowledgeable approach to the requisites and issues re: research ethics.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  The instructor is very good. He provided good explanations and examples , and he was open to answer students questions.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  good
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Made course material relevant and kept the environment non-threatening so students could ask questions and be involved in the conversation
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Hearing Dr. Tschudi's experiences in submitting and reviewing papers was insightful.
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Dr. Tschudi is a great instructor!
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Very nice teacher
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Good overall

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Kind of a waste of time.
A complete waste of time, but you have to take it anyway, so just focus on getting homework done for other classes during this time.
I would definitely recommend it to other students. This class is both interesting and useful.
Yes.
This is a brief and broad introduction to research and ethics. It's required but not painful, don't worry.
A more than manageable adequate overview of what is required for good research practices.
I would recommend the course. This is a basic course that provide an good overview of the main concepts in research ethics.
good
I would recommend it as the best version of an ethics class I have seen.
Yes, good class.
